zones_onboarding_description: The Domain Name System Zone (DNS) is the DNS configuration file that handles all of the addressing associated with a domain. You can use it to configure subdomains or the location of an email server. DNS zones contain technical information called records, which route data to the expected destination.
zones_onboarding_description2: When you configure a subdomain on a DNS, web users can then access the subdomain. You can do this in one click from the OVHcloud Control Panel, by attaching your subdomain to the directory containing the relevant files.
zones_onboarding_guide1_title: Creating an OVHcloud DNS zone for a domain name
zones_onboarding_guide1_description: Find out how to create an OVHcloud DNS zone for your domain name via the OVHcloud Control Panel
zones_onboarding_guide2_description: Find out how to edit an OVHcloud DNS zone via the OVHcloud Control Panel
